descriptionSet.description: A page from the film brochure of the Hindi movie "Mahaan" shows important scenes from the film. This movie was released in the year 1983 and had the male protagonist, Amitabh Bachhan in a triple role. The poster shows Amitabh in his three roles. In one image, the older character he plays is in a cage with his wife surrounded by flames. His wife Waheeda Rehman cries while Amitabh looks towards the flames. To the bottom left, Amitabh fights the villain, Amjad Khan, who holds a revolver in his hand. To the bottom right of the image, Amitabh figths with the second villain, Shakti Kapoor. To the top left are the female protagonists, Parveen Babi (left) and Zeenat Aman (right).

inscription.text: Satya Chitra International presents Mahaan CinemaScope Produced by Satyanarayana - Suryanarayana Directed by S. Ramanathan Music B.D. Burman

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

description-en: A page from the film brochure of the Hindi movie "Mahaan" shows important scenes from the film. This movie was released in the year 1983 and had the male protagonist, Amitabh Bachhan in a triple role. The poster shows Amitabh in his three roles. In one image, the older character he plays is in a cage with his wife surrounded by flames. His wife Waheeda Rehman cries while Amitabh looks towards the flames. To the bottom left, Amitabh fights the villain, Amjad Khan, who holds a revolver in his hand. To the bottom right of the image, Amitabh figths with the second villain, Shakti Kapoor. To the top left are the female protagonists, Parveen Babi (left) and Zeenat Aman (right). (gs/sb/sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Story line of the movie from the website imdb: Vikram (Amjad Khan) is arrested for possession of drugs, but claims that he was framed by Rajan (Sujit Kumar), his associate, but no one believes him. Desperately he turns to his lawyer friend, Vikram, only to have himself prosecuted at his very hands. Vikram gets sentenced, and upon his release goes to Amit and asks him to negotiate to get him his share of their former business from Rajan. Amit agrees to do so, but the negotiation gets bitter, argument ensues, followed by fisticuffs and use of firearms, which lead to the death of Rajan. It is now Amit's turn to be on the run from the law, as his pleas that he acted in self-defense are ignored, and there is no one to turn to for help. Amit's pregnant wife, Janki, asks him to run away somewhere safe, while she re-locates to another city until his file is closed or set aside. Amit runs to nearby Nepal, while Janki gives birth to twins... (gs)
related hyperlinks: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0085886/, last accessed 2011-12-14, story line, leading actors, director. (gs)
